s.text: Others have written about the Staples controversy and will continue to do so.
Chatterbox suspects the same is true of the ad signs; but even if there's stupendous value in the TV exposure that results, it's hard to see how the ads could be worth more than $500,000.
This suggests that, instead of paying $2 million to $3 million per year to the Staples Center, Downing should be paying something under $1 million.

The petition cites as the main precedent for such an investigation Donald Barlett and James Steele's Philadelphia Inquirer investigation of Laura Foreman in the late 1970s.
